content.description: This is a well bolted safe route by Needle standards. The route goes up a the rounded buttress.
content.location: This route is on the west side the formation. Look for a line of bolts going up the face. There is a seam at the bottom of the route that leads to face climbing. It is the right route of the two routes that are currently there.

climbs.name: Crimps and Cramps
climbs.fa: Josh Hammling, Steve Wilger, John Biddick, and Clark Machtemes

content.description: The full name is "Crimps and Cramps, and Farts from Gramps" in reference to Biddick as he was hammering on the drill.   The route starts in a steep water streak to gain the upper rounded arete. To reach the upper section of the route, you can slide a little right in a trough or make it a little harder and go straight up the bolt line.
content.protection: About 12 bolts to chains. Well bolted by Needle standards.
content.location: On the west side of the formation. It is the left of the current two routes in the area. The start is about 25 feet left of Up the Buttress.

content.description: The climbing area is on the back side of the formation as seen from the needles eye parking lot. It is down hill from the Goldline formation. The formation is not very impressive from the Needles Eye side, but the back side has a few sections of rock that are over 100 feet high.
